result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Luis Alfredo Roman
Current: 1210 Nicolet St, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 08-22-2017)
Prior: 815 N 29th St, #B, Wausau, WI 54401
Review hearing on May 10, 2017 at 01:10 pm.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:40am
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke.  Defendant appears in person with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. Spanish interpreter- Susan Rascon appears.

Spanish interpreter is sworn in and interprets
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  
State moves to:
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Battery- domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 6-9 months defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1

***DEOJ RH>> 05/10/17 at 1:10pm in DA's office
Bond continues.

Adj: 9:59am
Plea hearing on August 16, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2016 at 10:10 am.
Defendant getting assessment today? JT on?

Final pre-trial at 04-05-2016 03:00 pm.
Jury Trial at 05-17-2016 08:30 am.
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena hand delivered to C.J. 2/19/16

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 11:13am
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Deft appears with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. Spanish interpreter- Susan Rascon appears.

Spanish interpreter is sworn in and interprets
State says hearing for final pre-trial today and parties are close to reaching agreement 
Atty Kronenwetter has received offer by state prior to hearing today and parties are close to resolution
Atty Kroenwetter will contact Br 1 JA if resolution is found and plea to be set
COURT will keep JT on calender for 02/29/16 at 8:30am
Atty Kronenwetter has received all discovery and will be ready to proceed with JT is going
COURT advises parties to file MIL and have jury instructions in by 02/24/16 by 4:30pm
COURT advises parties to file MIL and proposed jury instructions 1 week before trial. 
36-40 Jurors to be called in. 

Adj: 11:16am

Final pre-trial at 02-17-2016 11:00 am.
Jury Trial at 02-29-2016 08:30 am.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:38am
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Jay Kronenwetter. Spanish interpreter- Darrius Torres appears to interpret
Date and time set for Jury Call

Spanish interpreter is sworn in and interprets
State says was scheduled for for jury trial but did not hear from defense attorney so today is scheduled for jury call
COURT was not hearing from defense Atty Kronenwetter regarding proceeding with JT
Atty Kronenwetter makes statement regarding communication breakdown between himself and defendant
Atty Kronenwetter states he had incorrect telephone number to contact defendant
Atty Kronenwetter states an offer has been given by the state and defendant does not want to accept offer
COURT states jury trial was to proceed today but was unable to due to Atty Kronenwetter's mistake
COURT will reset matter for final pre-trial a week before jury trial 
COURT advises both parties to reset matter with Br 1 JA
Bond continues

Adj: 8:44am
to Atty. Kronenwetter from Br. 1 JA

No contact with victim(s): M.S.-NON WAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.Family Resource Center for child exchange.
